notes.text:
An update for libxml2 is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The libxml2 library is a development toolbox providing the implementation of various XML standards.

Security Fix(es):

* libxml2: Use-after-free of ID and IDREF attributes (CVE-2022-23308)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in libxml2. A call to the xmlGetID function can return a pointer already freed when parsing an XML document with the XML_PARSE_DTDVALID option and without the XML_PARSE_NOENT option, resulting in a use-after-free issue.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libxml2: Use-after-free of ID and IDREF attributes
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The security impact of xmlGetID() returning a pointer to freed memory depends on the application and will mostly result in a denial of service (DoS). The typical use case of calling xmlGetID() on an unmodified document is not affected, therefore this issue was rated with a moderate severity.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The desktop must be restarted (log out, then log back in) for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: libxml2: Use-after-free of ID and IDREF attributes
